definitions.definition: a lack of knowledge or information about something
definitions.sensetop: ignorance of somethingignorance about somethingin ignorance of somethingout of ignorancethrough ignorance

examples.text: They fought a long battle against prejudice and ignorance.
I hate to admit my ignorance, but how does it work?
He showed a remarkable ignorance of the facts.
They were kept in ignorance of their government's activities.
Children often behave badly out of ignorance.
Many lives are lost through ignorance.
He pleaded ignorance of any wrongdoing.
Outsiders, in their ignorance, fail to understand this.
These attitudes are based on ignorance and fear.
This showed a profound ignorance of local customs.

definitions.definition: the state of not knowing about something and so being unable to worry about it

examples.text: We preferred to remain in blissful ignorance of what was going on.

definitions.definition: if you do not know about something, you cannot worry about it

examples.text: Some doctors believe ignorance is bliss and don't give their patients all the facts.

wordOrigin: Middle English: via Old French from Latin ignorantia, from ignorant- ‘not knowing’, from the verb ignorare ‘not know, ignore’, from in- ‘not’ + gno-, a base meaning ‘know’.
